de.fhg.fit.biomos.sensorplatform.tools

Interface Gatttool

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Runnable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GatttoolImpl

    public interface Gatttool
extends Runnable
    Defines a hardware abstraction layer to interact with the gatttool command line tool from Bluez.
    Author:
    Daniel Pyka

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Gatttool.Mode 
      static class  Gatttool.State

      boolean connectBlocking(int timeout)
      Try to connect to a sensor.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnect gracefully from the sensor.
      void exitGatttool()
      Exit gatttool gracefully to properly shut down the process and release all resources.
      Gatttool.Mode getInternalMode() 
      Gatttool.State getInternalState()
      Expose the internal state of the Gatttool.
      BufferedWriter getStreamToSensor()
      Expose process input stream to be used in a sensorobject.

    • Method Detail

      • getInternalState

        Gatttool.State getInternalState()
        Expose the internal state of the Gatttool. SensorOverseer makes use of it.
        Returns:
        State the state the gatttool is currently in

      • getInternalMode

        Gatttool.Mode getInternalMode()

      • setInternalMode

        void setInternalMode(Gatttool.Mode mode)

      • getStreamToSensor

        BufferedWriter getStreamToSensor()
        Expose process input stream to be used in a sensorobject.
        Returns:
        stream to the gatttool process

      • setObserver

        void setObserver(AbstractSensorWrapper<?> observer)
        Set the observer.
        Parameters:
        observer - SensorWrapper is the observer

      • connectBlocking

        boolean connectBlocking(int timeout)
        Try to connect to a sensor.
        Parameters:
        timeout - int number of seconds to try connecting
        Returns:
        true if connected successfully, false otherwise

      • reconnect

        void reconnect()
        Try to connect to a sensor again, if gatttool has lost the previous connection (maybe because sensor went offline).

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
        Disconnect gracefully from the sensor.

      • exitGatttool

        void exitGatttool()
        Exit gatttool gracefully to properly shut down the process and release all resources.
